intro: Sisyrinchium bromelioides subsp. bromelioides, commonly known as the narrowleaf blue-eyed grass, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its grass-like appearance with narrow, linear leaves. The plant produces striking blue to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in woodland or wetland habitats. Its botanical features make it a valuable addition to native plant gardens and ecological restoration projects.
